TextView.android:text: Ujra Mosque is a treat to the eyes! Located in the south-eastern part of Kavaratti Island, the hustle and bustle of the streets give way to a strange calm as one follows the narrow lanes leading to the mosque. The religious center is unique because it does not hold prayers and devotees only visit to meditate and not offer regular namaz. So the mosque has been designed accordingly. A thing of beauty built on an elevated platform, the mosque does not have minarets, unlike other mosques. The structure is similar to the temples of coastal Kerala, with sloping tiled roofs to protect the interiors from the rain that the island gets round the year. The mosque is best known to the outside world for its beautifully carved pillars and the elaborately designed verandah. Every inch of the four pillars is carved elaborately with different designs in each of the different pillars.

This aquarium is one of the amazing tourist destinations for all those who are planning to visit Kavaratti Island. From all over the country and even from the entire world, lots of tourist visits the aquarium to see its beauty and charm. It is one of the beautiful attractions in Kavaratti Island that make it an ideal kind of tourist spot which offer great fun to the visitors coming from all over the world.

Unspoilt by commercialisation, the Kavaratti Island is the perfect holiday destination for tourists. There are lots in store for visitors on the island. Water sports is the most common amongst tourist activities which include banana boat ride, snorkelling, speed boating, scuba diving, glass bottom ride and several others. There are varieties of fishes and corals here. Locals and staff on the island, jetty and ship are very friendly and helpful, leaving visitors with no complaints whatsoever. The lagoon is also great for swimming. There is a lighthouse as well on the island which is a great spot for relaxing and watching sunset-views. The entire experience is immensely enriching and exhilarating.
